attributes.action: Stop child sex offenders from joining public court cases on child sex abuse
attributes.background: To stop convicted child sex abusers from going into the public gallery at court in another case of child sexual abuse and listening to all the evidence and descriptions of child sexual abuse/ assault.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about who can sit in the public gallery at court are a matter for HM Courts & Tribunals Service, not the UK Government or Parliament.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-courts-and-tribunals-service
